titleStmt.title: Letter, R. H. Cartell in Staunton, Va., to Col. I.T.L. Preston in Lexington, Va.1871 Dec. 12

bibl.title: Letter, R.H. Cartell in Staunton, Va., to Col. I.T.L. Preston in Lexington, Va. 1871 Dec 12
bibl.note: R. H. Cartell wrote to Col. I.T.L. Preston on December 12, 1871 to inform him that Arthur Ramsey's remains could be put in a walnut coffin and interred in a Confederate cemetery in Staunton for $25.00 plus the cost of a marble stone ranging from $15.00-$30.00.

projectDesc.p: Machine-readable transcription created for the University of Tennessee Libraries Special Collections.

editorialDecl.p: Errors in transcription of the printed text not controlled.
Editorial tags limited to gap and unclear.
Catchwords and directional notes such as "turn page over" have been omitted.

keywords.term: Soldiers' bodies, Disposition of -- Southern States -- 19th century.

revisionDesc.change: Migrating from XML to validated TEI P5.

div.p: I retd. from West Virginia a few days since and found your favor of the 5 church .

Mr Bukle , our undertaker, says he will reniure the remains of Young Ramsey and inter them here, in a walnut coffin, for $25. A plain marble slabwill cost from $15 to$30., according to the quality of the stone andthe length of the inscription-
We have a Confederate burial ground here.
